messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Parody of Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Aw c mon, she thinks she s being trendy and funny! What amazes me is how eager people are to show that they are incapable of spending any time with their
messages.messageBody:
Aw c'mon, she thinks she's being trendy and funny!

What amazes me is how eager people are to 'show' that they are incapable of spending any time with their kids, and how incapable their kids are of learning anything that's not forced into their heads by someone better qualified for the job than Mom.

Then again, who cares what she thinks anyway? If that's as clever and involved as she can be, it's a good thing her kids go to school.

Sylvia

messages.subject: Parody of Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: My Unschooling google alert turned up this gem: http:// www.nashvillescene.com/Stories/Columns/Suburban_Turmoil/2006/11/23/ Alternative_Learning/index.shtml
messages.messageBody:
My "Unschooling" google alert turned up this gem: http://
www.nashvillescene.com/Stories/Columns/Suburban_Turmoil/2006/11/23/
Alternative_Learning/index.shtml

It's a very sarcastic parody of someone's idea of unschooling. I
thought it was very mean-spirited and demeaning to her children.

Chris in IA
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/IAUnschoolers/
http://zamunzo.blogspot.com/
